tool_description: Customisable QR Codes. Support for styles, images and more! Bare metal engine gives it incredible speed. Full documentation can be found at: https://linqr.app/docs
name: QRCode
title: QRCode

api_list.name: List image
api_list.description: This endpoint allows you to list single image hosted in the LinQR storage.

test_endpoint.message: This endpoint is disabled for your subscription

size.title: Size
size.description: Size of the source file in bytes

created.title: Created
created.description: The creation time of the image.

api_list.name: List all images
api_list.description: This endpoint allows you to list images hosted in the LinQR storage. If there are no images hosted, an empty array is returned.
api_list.code:
import requests

url = "https://qrcode3.p.rapidapi.com/images"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "qrcode3.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())
api_list.convert_code:
import requests

url = "https://qrcode3.p.rapidapi.com/images"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "qrcode3.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())

test_endpoint.message: This endpoint is disabled for your subscription

api_list.name: Text QR Code
api_list.description: This endpoint allows you to create a QR Code containing any text, in particular, an URL that may redirect the user to the website. After QR code is scanned, website will be displayed to the user.

api_list.name: Upload image
api_list.description: This endpoint allows you to upload images to LinQR storage. In the response, metadata of the submitted image is sent, including the identifier used by other endpoints from the `Image management` group for image identification.

required_parameters.name: image
required_parameters.description: Binary file to be uploaded into LinQR storage. Maximum single file size is 1MiB (1,048,576 bytes).

api_list.name: Contact QR Code
api_list.description: This endpoint allows you to create a QR Code that allows user to quickly add contact information to the phone book. The code contains an appropriately encoded electronic business card. After scanning, the device prompts to save the contact in the phone book.

api_list.name: Geolocation QR Code
api_list.description: This endpoint allows you to create a QR Code that allows to share location with the user. The code contains appropriately encoded geographic coordinates. After scanning the code, device maps application is invoked, pointing to the selected location (address).

api_list.name: Telephone QR Code
api_list.description: This endpoint allows you to create a QR Code that allows user to make quick telephone call. The code contains appropriately encoded telephone number. After scanning the code, device dialer is invoked with prefilled phone number. To make a call, the user only needs to press the green phone key.

api_list.name: Cryptocurrency payment QR Code
api_list.description: This endpoint allows you to create a QR Code that allows user to make a quick cryptocurrency transfer. The code contains appropriately encoded data for the payment. After scanning the code, the cryptocurrency wallet application asks user to perform the transfer without rewriting all necessary data.

api_list.name: SMS QR Code
api_list.description: This endpoint allows you to create a QR Code that allows user to quickly send SMS. The code contains appropriately encoded recipient number and message template. After scanning the code, device message application is invoked with prefilled phone number and text, ready to be sent. To send a SMS, the user only needs to press *Send* button.

api_list.name: WiFi QR Code
api_list.description: This endpoint allows you to create a QR Code that allows user to quickly connect to a WiFi network. The code contains properly encoded network credentials. After scanning, the device can automatically connect to the network without having to enter the password manually.

api_list.name: Arbitrary data type QR Code
api_list.description: This endpoint aggregates the functionality of all other endpoints in the group. The data type in the `data` field is recognized automatically and the data is encoded in an appropriate way.

api_list.name: Email QR Code
api_list.description: This endpoint allows the creation of a QR Code allowing the user to quickly send an email. The code contains an appropriately encoded message template. After scanning, the device starts the e-mail client with pre-filled specified fields.

data.subject: Example subject
data.body:
Example message body for Email QRCode.

Regards,
LinQR

api_list.name: QR Code Batch
api_list.description: This endpoint allows you to generate an archive containing multiple QR Codes with a single request. The endpoint response is the archive containing the generated image files and `items.json` file which is a record of the specifications of each of the files in the archive.
api_list.code:
import requests

url = "https://qrcode3.p.rapidapi.com/batch/qrcode"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "qrcode3.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.post(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())
api_list.convert_code:
import requests

url = "https://qrcode3.p.rapidapi.com/batch/qrcode"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "qrcode3.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.post(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())
